page.title: 01CRUDWELL & SURROUNDING AREA
page.content: The population of{Crudwell}is about 1,000.On the{edge of the cotswolds}it is typical of the area.A mixture of old and new houses are built of local stone.{The busy A429 Chippenham to {Cirencester road}runs through the village.Round Crudwell is{agricultural {land}which is divided up into many farms.The main crops are wheat,barley and grass for hay or silage.In the centre are the{school, church and {village green.}Along the main road are the{village hall,blacksmith,shops, {hotels and pubs.}The village has existed since before the original Domesday book but is still changing as new houses are built.Many large towns such as Swindon,Bristol and Cheltenham are close.There is a strong sense of tradition and community in the village.{It is a peaceful,attractive {place to live in or visit.
